result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan T. Boettcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Parties to stipulate on credit for any time served.

miscConds.notes: Payment of Restitution = $1,355.60 (includes surcharge) - payment to be taken from bond on deposit.

Payment of costs, fees and DNA surcharge on each count - payment to be taken from bond on deposit.
Bond on deposit to be applied to restitution first, fees second and any Dean fees dues, with any remaining balance to be returned to poster.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription. 
Must take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed.
No contact with any of the victims, except father, or only with prior agent approval.

Full compliance with the Marinette County Mental health Court treatment program, and all fees associated with the program.
Will have to reside in Marinette, if any MHC appointments are missed.
Completion of all assessments, counseling nad follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 9-6-2022.

timeConds.notes: 1 year jail - imposed and stayed - to be used by Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.

2:31 PM Defendant Jonathan T. Boettcher in court.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Jonathan T. Boettcher.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. Lisa Spencer, Mental Health Coordinator is present in the courtroom.
DA heard - this is a global resolution.
Court calls cases 22CF93. 22CF120, 22CF147, 22CF148 (Branch 1 case).
Court speaks to Deft and his father, who is present in the courtroom.
Deft understands.
Deft's father is heard and understands.
Atty Zoellner provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Zoellner agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CF93.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 4 of 22CF93.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Def on Count 1 of 22CF120.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CF147.
Deft enters a plea of guilty.
Non-citizen advisory.
No Firearms.
May not vote of serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Zoellner satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Counts 1 and 4 of 22CF93, Count 1 of 22CF120, and Count 1 of 22CF147.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, and 5 of 22CF93.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 of 22CF120.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 22CF147.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 2, and 3 of 22CF148.
Court will not order a PSI to be completed.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 22CF93: 
3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Parties to stipulate on credit for any time served.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 4 of 22CF93:
18 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to Count 1 of 22CF93, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 22CF147:
3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, consecutive to 22CF93, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1 of 22CF120:
9 months jail, consecutive to 22CF147, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Conditions of probation the same for all counts and all cases:
Full compliance with the Marinette County Mental Health Court treatment program, and all fees associated with the program.
Will have to reside in Marinette, if any MHC appointments are missed.
Payment of restitution = $1355.60 (including surcharge) - payment to be taken from bond on deposit.
Payment of costs, fees, and the DNA surcharge on each count - payment to be taken from bond on deposit.
Bond on deposit to be applied to restitution first, fees second, and any Dean fees dues, with any remaining balance to be returned to bond poster.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
Must take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed.
No contact with any of the victims, except father, or only with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
1 year jail - imposed and stayed - to be used by Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.
DNA sample due 09-06-2022.
